action.action-desc: Mr. LaMalfa (for himself, Mr. Garamendi, Mr. Jones, Mr. Gallagher, Mr. Duffy, Mr. Panetta, and Ms. Kaptur) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and the Workforce

form.official-title: To amend the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act to require a school food authority to make publicly available any waiver of the Buy American requirement, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the American Food for American Schools Act of 2017.

section.header: Waiver to purchase foreign commodities or products

subsection.text: Section 12(n)(2) of the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act (42 U.S.C. 1760(n)(2)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (A), by striking subparagraph (B) and inserting subparagraphs (B) and (C); and
by adding at the end the following:

clause.text: Except as provided in clause (ii), a school food authority shall request from the Secretary a waiver of subparagraph (A) to purchase foreign commodities or products.
A school food authority may purchase foreign commodities or products without a waiver under clause (i) if such commodities or products are not—
The Secretary may not grant a waiver to purchase foreign commodities or products under clause (i) unless—

item.text: are not produced domestically in sufficient amounts or of satisfactory quality; and
if purchased domestically, would be significantly higher in price than such foreign commodities or products; and

subclause.text: the school enters into an agreement under clause (iv).

clause.text: The Secretary may not grant a waiver under clause (i) unless the school food authority requesting such waiver agrees to—

subclause.text: make the waiver publicly available on the website of the school food authority; and
email a notification of the waiver to parents or guardians of students who will be served the foreign commodity or product purchased pursuant to such waiver.

subsection.text: Section 12(n)(1) of the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act (42 U.S.C. 1760(n)(1)) is amended to read as follows:

subparagraph.text: The term domestic commodity or product means—

clause.text: an agricultural commodity that is produced in the United States; and
a food product that is processed in the United States substantially using agricultural commodities that are produced in the United States.

subparagraph.text: The term foreign commodity or product means a commodity or product other than a domestic commodity or product.

subsection.text: Section 12(n) of the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act (42 U.S.C. 1760(n)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (3), by striking Paragraph (2)(A) and inserting Subparagraphs (A) and (C) of paragraph (2); and
in paragraph (4), by striking Paragraph (2)(A) and inserting Subparagraphs (A) and (C) of paragraph (2).
